page.title: 13A LOCAL SPORTING EVENT
page.content: On 29th July 1985 there was a local sporting event in aid of the{Bradford {City}disaster appeal. Following the deaths of 56 people at the Bradford football ground in May {AFC {Bournemouth}played{Tottenham Hotspur} in a friendly cricket match at the{ {Hurn Bridge}sports ground, any money raised was to be sent to relatives of the the dead and injured. {AFC Bournemouth}batted first and managed to muster 96 runs in their 22 overs, England internationals{Glen {Hoddle}and{Graham Roberts}fielding and bowling particularly well.{Tottenham's {innings got}off to a bad start, the first three wickets falling very quickly. The recovery came however and Tottenham managed to overtake the {Bournemouth}score with two wickets in hand.{ { **** The game raised Â£170 ****
